meanings.sent1: The small team felt undermanned during the busy season.
meanings.sent2: The factory was undermanned, causing delays in production.
meanings.sent3: The undermanned crew tried to juggle multiple tasks at once.
meanings.sent4: The undermanned staff struggled to keep up with the workload.
meanings.sent5: The undermanned department needed more hands on deck to meet deadlines.

meanings.definition: Not having enough people to adequately perform a task or duty.
meanings.sent1: The undermanned police force struggled to cover all areas of the city.
meanings.sent2: The undermanned team couldn't finish the project on time.
meanings.sent3: The undermanned group tried to do the work of three people.
meanings.sent4: The undermanned crew was like a ship without a crew.
meanings.sent5: The undermanned squad needed reinforcements to succeed.
